overview: This subject continues to develop the technical skills individual performers require in Jazz and Improvisation.
The subject includes individual lessons with expert practitioners, as well as group classes, which focus on the art of improvisation and developing the ability to compose and perform in real time.
intended learning outcomes: employ intermediate level techniques of functional harmony as related to jazz-based chord construction;
employ intermediate level techniques of contemporary rhythmic practice;
identify their strengths and weaknesses in technical development and implement strategies for improvement;
appraise their practice regime in terms of efficacy in achieving development goals;
apply an intermediate level understanding of non genre-based compositional tools to improvisation;
explore the connection between 'real-time' composition and concepts of 'flow' and 'play';
critically self-reflect and apply creative problem-solving to their development as improvising musicians.

assessments.description:
15 to 20-minute Individual Technical Exam
(Principal Study). 60 hours (of work required). Hurdle requirement:. Students must obtain a pass in the Principal Study assessment to be eligible for a pass in this subject.
Active contribution to class discussions and activities as directed (Performance related skills). 20 hours (of work required)
Hurdle requirement:. Students must attend a minimum of 75% of all scheduled classes.

Semester 1.Contact hours: 39 hours, comprising 9 hours Individual and Group Principal Study lessons, 18 hours Group Improvisation Materials class and 12 hours Performance Related Skills classes.

Semester 2.Contact hours: 39 hours, comprising 9 hours Individual and Group Principal Study lessons, 18 hours Group Improvisation Materials class and 12 hours Performance Related Skills classes.

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
